I so wanted Vera to work. But it suffered from endless zwave connection problems, a corrupted database, and intermittent connectivity. The Vera Customer Service is good,  it it cannot make up for a fundamentally poor quality product.

The final straw was that I discovered that many devices that are listed as compatible are Not...On,y older firmware on these devices is supported. To make the device work you must downgrade the firmware to older, obsolete versions. (Such as Aeotec Switch 6) This is complicated, time consuming, error prone, and a pain.

You should also know that Vera does not support logical operations or variables, so if you want a lamp to be on if BOTH a particular scene is active and a device is on this is not possible. You CANNOT use the dimmer brightness setting from one device to set the brightness on other devices.

Yes, there is a tool called PLEG that you can use to implement some logic, but it is less than obvious and I found it couldn‚Äôt do the types of things I needed (such as synchronizing brightness levels for multiple lamps.)

The summary is that Vera has great customer service but a terribly unreliable and outdated product.

title: Great Product and "honest" business model
text:
For full disclosure: I am using Vera for many many years and come to enjoy the reliability and straightforward business model (NO monthly subscritpions! They are doing it the "honest" way: produce good HW, sell it at a good price AND provide good customer support).

The reason I'm doing a review right now: My Vera Plus stopped working. Oh no! 50 Z-wave devices are dead (some not really accessibel behind furniture). I so dreaded unpairing all those, and migrating to a new unit.
Turns out, Vera support was super cool: I opened a ticket, they assigned a support person, asked for a time-/date-slot at which I could be contacted. All within 48hours. The person called on-time(!), asked for remote access (like: remote desktop/teamviewer) and I watched him fixing the problem in ~20minutes. Turns out, the problem was an old App (Plug-in) I had loaded years earlier to test and and never really used it... but forgot to remove it also. It just sat there, unsupported by the plug-in dev and it caused memory exhaustion in the Vera unit. After removing it, doing a garbage mem collection, the Vera runs like new.
Back to Vera's "honest" business model: no subscritpion and STILL reliable support. How many companies fall in to the "Greed Trap" as I call it, to force customers into subscription models. It's only good for the constant revenue stream of the company and very seldom provides benefits for the customer. I avoid subscriptions like the plague.
If all sounds over-the-top, sorry: I am that impressed with Vera and feel confirmed in that opinion after the last unit-recovery/remote-support. 
Cheers! Lutz

title: Piece of crap
text: I have never written a review for an app for as long as I have existed, but I will say that this app is the absolute biggest piece of crap I have ever had the displeasure of using. title: Great for basics
text:
Overall the app does what it claims to do.  That said, it does have some issues as well as limitations. As an example, Alerts seems to only inform you when a door lock (Kwikset in my case) goes to the locked state.  Unfortunately I am really only concerned with be notified when it is unlocked.  The fact that it natively only supports a few camera brands makes it a little less valuable too. 

Another problem I see is that when you attempt to change the state of a device (e.g. unlocked to locked) the app seems to show a spinning progress indicator that never stops unless you exit and reenter the app. 

So if you are ok with minor buggy behavior and a few limitations, this is a decent  app.

title: Micasa Vera3 & Get Vera Home Auto/Sec
text: This is my first version of this APP and our first use of the MiCasa Vera 3 controller. After taking some time to understand some of these items this system works flawlessly! This has been a lot of fun installing, not done yet because of the ability to expand as you go but I can see where this system would be the very best value. title: Not ready for prime time
text: Neither app nor the actual home automation system is ready for release. It is a very poorly executed engineering concept. title: Improving, still needs work
text:
2.0 fixes the need to log in every 24 hours for me. Big improvement, I'll give another star for that!

However, now door locks are broken for me with the update.

Have not re-tried setting password, so no idea if complexity is still enforced.

title: VeraPlus + VeraLite Home controllers
text:
My current controller is the Plus. This app really works well and consistently for my family and I.  There is almost a perfect (100%) response rate when using on either local or through the remote relay.  

If you are a power user, I recommend signing up with Vera devs to beta test as you will receive access through TestFlight app.  They keep it current and are extremely responsive to input/issues.  Devs are dedicated and are willing to work with the user.  Lot of  small issues/requests to work out with the firmware for the new controller as well as the app, but it just works for basic device control.  Reliable.

title: Crashes Consistently
text:
If you haven't yet upgraded to 2.2, I would definitely hold off. The app locks up without fail. I have restarted phone, rebooted Veralite, restarted app at least 20 times. Using an iPhone 6 Plus in case it matters, I will definitely update this review after the issue is resolved. 

Looking forward to geofencing, and the DSC Alarm module looks more polished from the favorites screen. I did try to arm my alarm and it actually froze my alarm keypad so hopefully that is part of the same problem. Now nothing responds within the app.

Update 8/9/16:

Been using the app for several months now with huge success. Most issues have been fixed for me, logging in is as fast as can be expected now with the help of Touch ID. I have an occasional hiccup but usually it's the veralite's issue. 

I see some very recent reviews of people have similar problems that I had long ago and wonder if I am just lucky. Using the same iPhone 6 Plus with around 50 z wave devices on Veralite.

title: Major Security Risk to the U.S.
text: Popular VeraLite runs notifications through its own servers, taking 20+ minutes (if ever) to get a notification via text.  Check the forums.  The fix? Buy a plugin.  Seriously that's the fix.  Supposedly from Texas.  The Vera software product is built in Hong Kong with Romanian offices.  To get notifications with the Vera Alerts plugin you have to enter your SMTP server/user/pass.  Gmail doesn't work.  All in clear text through the MiCasa servers and btw they can login and see your setup.  And as for the iOS app, long delay and gripe message at every load that you haven't given continuous access to your GPS location.  While waiting, if you jump back to the home screen when waiting to load, it freezes up.  Sketchy stuff, looking to move to a U.S. based product like Indigo.

title: Clunky, but works. Alexa support? Huh?
text: It's clunky to get it to sync with devices. Doing a door knob install might want to sync the door knob BEFORE you install it (unless you have a 50ft cat5 to bring the device closer to the door later). The latest version of the app states Alexa supported, but the Alexa skills search menu has nothing matching "Vera". All in all the controller is a decent value for the price. Getting better with age, but by the time it gets going better there are newer devices coming out all the time that are a bit more intuitive to use. Been using this now three years with my Vera.

title: Great app and system
text: I use the Vera system to make my home a smart tech home as well as a security system.  Even though this app and system is great and all that one would need to setup a smart home as well as a great security system, it does take some tech knowledge to make it work just perfect.  Vera tech support is great and very helpful.  The software setup and engineering of the program needs some more fine tuning as well as a more user friendly approach.  I would recommend this system to anyone that needs to setup a smart home that does not want to be paying some company monthly fees.

title: Needs work
text:
This app is just ok.  It does what it needs to do but does it very poorly. 

My biggest complaint is the app is just slow. When you launch it your forced to wait for it to update. Your devices are hard to find and you have to navigate menus to find things (honestly it would be better and faster if they were in one big master list sorted alphabetically then what they currently have). When I launch the app I have a clear goal in mind (e.g turning a fan on) and they certainly do not make that process easy. Bottom line is that when I'm in bed it's simple to just get out of bed and turn the fan on with the physical switch than it is to use the app which shouldn't be the case. 

The other problem is when you turn a switch on, it immediately switches off, and then a short time later switches back on - in other words they are waiting for confirmation from the controller before they show the desired state of your switch. 

All of this tells me they are more interested in releasing new products than they are in making their app a first class experience.

title: Nice recent update
text:

I just test my front door lock and it does not work. I have to change 3 stars since it breaks one of the features. Please fix it.

title: Improvement but not quite there yet

title: So far the best one out there for Vera

title: Works well to keep me connected to Vera

title: This is pathetic compared to Nexia

title: Thank you Support

.

.

title: Not Experiencing the Issues

title: Outstanding Home Automation Hub
text:
I just recently upgraded to the Vera Plus from a Vera Edge for some extra horsepower.  I‚Äôve used the Vera hubs for quite a few years now and very happy with them.  I like the ability to make my own luup code for specific scene conditions I may want to use as a trigger.  The forum has a ton of example code to use and learn from.   In the beginning you don‚Äôt need to do this but after a while you will love the fact that it is an option.  

Support has been very responsive whenever I need help.  I have no idea why there are so many negative reviews.   The reality is home automation is not always simple and you need to read forums occasionally to fix things.  

Bottom line is this product has been giving me rock solid performance for years. I have over 45 device ids and over 50 scenes and it just works.  Everything from integrating my existing dsc alarm system to full Alexa control over devices and scenes, to energy monitoring.   Vera engineering is always adding new devices so I see no reason to go anywhere else.   

This product rocks.

text:
MMS Vera is unusable on a non retina ipad on IOS7. iOS 7 makes two significant changes to non-Retina iPads‚Äô handling of apps with iPhone/iPod-specific interfaces. Previously, non-Retina iPads displayed iPhone/iPod apps at a classic 480x320 resolution, upscaling them with a ‚Äú2X‚Äù button to a larger, chunky-looking 960x640 window. On a non-Retina iPad 2 or iPad mini running iOS 7, the apps are now displayed at the larger size by default, but use the higher-resolution text and graphics seen on the Retina iPhone 4/4S and fourth-generation iPod touch, while removing the ability to shrink to ‚Äú1X‚Äù size. Retina iPads, however, still give users the choice of toggling between 1x and 2x mode.

Now, on an non retina iPad on I0S7 the username and password fields display, but the bottom with login, create account is cut off. in fact you only see half of the Vera Logo and you cannot login.
